text:
Beautiful station of a new line in the MRT network. No idea about the meaning of the red gramophone-shaped ornament at the concourse level but it looks very unique.

Another thing I noticed with the new TE-Line stations is that path guides for queue aren't installed yet along the platform door. Perhaps the SMRT will do it some time later, especially after the JB Sentral-Woodlands North line completed (thus multiplies the ridership from the current base)?

Orchard Boulevard MRT station provides convenient access to the Singapore Edition hotel, offering guests seamless connectivity to the city’s bustling shopping and entertainment district. With its proximity to Orchard Road, this MRT station serves as a convenient transportation hub for visitors exploring the vibrant attractions of Singapore’s iconic shopping street.
The driverless Singapore MRT is really comfortable and safe

Beautiful MRT station next to Tanglin Mall.
Love this place.

Newly opened station serving the "hidden" westernmost portion of Orchard Road that most tourists to Singapore don't know about

Orchard Road actually begins in the middle between this station and Orchard station, but there's still a handful of shopping malls nearer to this station (most notably Tanglin Mall)

Several embassies are located nearby here. If you need to go to the embassies of China, Myanmar, Indonesia, Japan, the Philippines or the UK High Commission, you should alight here (not at Napier), though it'll still be quite a walk
